pullRequest.title: Firebase Data Collection:- Add tri states to the data collection api
pullRequest.bodyText: Add tri state for the dataCollectionsetter in firebase-common

commit.message: add tri state to common data collection flag

nodes.bodyText: I am pretty sure this is a breaking change for old SDKs that call this method.
Why is it no longer atomic? do we not care about concurrency anymore?
Can be extracted into a function?
Should this also live inside the synchronized block?

You do need to synchronize here, before your change synchronization was happening with the atomic bool, but since you are checking for null now, a bunch of races become possible, i.e. concurrent threads can enter different branches of this if block and cause mess up the resulting state.
You may want to rename this to deviceProtectedContext since you changed the logic inside
Since the method is now synchronized there is no point for the bool to be atomic. Also very important to make isEnabled() synchronized as well.
How does this test work if it's using user credential encrypted context?(i.e. not the direct boot one?)
pls revert this change, lgtm otherwise
